LT+2.0 isn't installed onto the HDD its flashed to your Xbox DVD drive, you need LT+2.0 flashed too be able to play the new breed of games as well as the newest dash update, most games run smoother once they are installed to your HDD also it cuts down on ware to your Xbox DVD drives laser so its better all round to install backup games

Will never work on Hitachi drives under 78 firmware. There is no LT 2.0 planned to be made for any of them.  If you have a Hitachi < 78, then you will need a new Xbox with a newer drive to be flashed.

OR, you will need to buy xKey or Wasabi to play the ISO itself.  You only need your KEY.BIN for Wasabi.  You need your firmware with key in it for the xKey.   They allow you to play ISOs from an external drive.  WASABI has a eSATA port, for optimal speed, the xKey does not.

@ celticfcps, all my torrents are on a seed box but since i only do xbox360 games all the uploads are large (6 - 16GB). I also upload on many sites which means a higher load which slows the speed down for everyone. It wouldn't be so bad if people seeded what they take but too many hit and run!!!

Im not saying you torrents are dodgy or anything far from it i would like nothing better to download and seed as your work in getting the latest releases is much appreciated

@ Doddy2279, you should try another client, bittorrent, vuze, or like you say utorrent. Surely downloading slow is better than not downloading at all!!! Try utorrent, then go to youtube to find out the correct settings to speed it up.

Ok, advice would be appreciated. ive ripped a variety of both XGD2 and XGD3 games on to disc. ive played them on my xbox flashed with LT 2.0 and with no problem. Recently heard about ABGX and the procedure of installing a stealth patch on to XGD2 files. am i at risk if i havent already. ive been straight up downloading/ripping and playing with no steps in between. Any ADVICE would be appreciated. 

also email if possible: paul.sanderson@live.co.uk

@ celticfcps, abgx is used for patching XGD2 games so you can play them online. If your going to use xbox live you should download and install abgx360 and all the video waves then run the iso through the program before you burn to disc. If you don't use xbox live abgx is also useful for checking the iso for crc faults before you burn so that you don't waste discs. XGD3 games that have been ripped with the 0800 firmware do not require abgx patching as they are exact copies and do not need to be patched.
